data.title: Rabbis from Frankfurt
data.text:
Overview: Dayan Chanoch Ehrentreu (27 December 1932 in Frankfurt-am-Main – 24 November 2022 in London) served for many years as the head of the London Beth Din in Great Britain (also known as The Court of the Chief ...

Date of birth: 1932

Date of death: 24 November 2022

Age: 90 (age at death)

Nationality: German

Overview: Shabtai Horowitz (Hebrew: שבתי הורוויץ; c. 1590 – 12 April 1660) was a rabbi and talmudist, probably born in Ostroh, Volhynia. He was the son of the kabbalist Isaiah Horowitz, and at an early age married ...

Date of birth: 1590

Date of death: 1660

Age: 69 (age at death)

Nationality: Czech

Overview: Abraham Geiger (Hebrew: אַבְרָהָם גִייגְר ʼAvrāhām Gīgər; 24 May 1810 – 23 October 1874) was a German rabbi and scholar, considered the founding father of Reform Judaism. Emphasizing Judaism's c ...

Date of birth: 24 May 1810

Date of death: 23 October 1874

Age: 64 (age at death)

Nationality: German

Occupation: Historian

Gender: Male

Overview: Joseph Breuer (1882–1980) was a rabbi and community leader in Germany and the United States. He was a Rabbi of one of the large Jewish synagogues founded by German-Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi oppression ...

Date of birth: 1882

Date of death: 1980

Age: 97 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Overview: Moses Schreiber (1762–1839), known to his own community and Jewish posterity in the Hebrew translation as Moshe Sofer, also known by his main work Chatam Sofer, Chasam Sofer or Hatam Sofer, (trans. Seal ...

Date of birth: 26 September 1762

Date of death: 3 October 1839

Age: 77 (age at death)

Overview: Rabbi Mechel Scheuer was born in Frankfurt am Main in 1739 to his father Rabbi David Tebele Scheuer. He led his father's Yeshiva in Mainz as its Rosh Yeshiva during the years 1776 and 1777.

Date of birth: 1739

Date of death: 1810

Age: 70 (age at death)

Overview: Nathan Adler (1741–1800) was a German kabbalist and Rosh yeshiva. He was responsible for training several prominent rabbis of the era.

Date of birth: 1741

Date of death: 1800

Age: 58 (age at death)

Occupation: Writer

Overview: Alexander Suslin HaKohen (died 1349) was a prominent 14th century rabbinic authority born in Erfurt, Germany, and one of the most important Talmudists of his time. He was rabbi first in Cologne and Worms ...

Date of death: 1349

Occupation: Writer
